meanings.definition: A situation in which no progress can be made due to a deadlock or obstruction.
meanings.sent1: The logjam in the traffic made everyone late for work.
meanings.sent2: The logjam of ideas in the meeting prevented any decisions from being made.
meanings.sent3: The logjam of toys in the playroom made it impossible to walk without tripping.
meanings.sent4: The logjam of emails in my inbox felt like a mountain I couldn't climb.
meanings.sent5: The logjam of fallen leaves in the gutter created a colorful but frustrating sight.

meanings.definition: To cause a blockage or deadlock in a process or situation.
meanings.sent1: Please don't logjam the printer with too many print requests at once.
meanings.sent2: His stubbornness tends to logjam any attempts at compromise.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally logjammed the sink by letting food scraps go down the drain.
meanings.sent4: Her absence logjammed the progress of the project, as she held crucial information.
meanings.sent5: The fallen tree logjammed the river, creating a temporary barrier to the water flow.
